About Today: St. Eudoxia, Venerable-Martyr. At first she led a profligate life but was baptized by Theodotus, Bishop. Arrested, she was beheaded for her Christianity about A.D. 107 during the leadership of Diogenes, in the reign of Trajan, Emperor.
Remarks: The Divine Liturgy of St. Basil is celebrated.

About Today: St. Theodotus, Priest-Martyr Bishop of Cyrene, on the Island of Cyprus, was imprisoned, tortured for the Faith under Diocletian, Emperor. He survived and died peacefully A.D. 325.
Remarks: Monday to Friday in the Great Fast are aliturgical (without Divine Liturgy) days. The Presanctified Divine Liturgy is celebrated on Wednesday and Friday.

About Today: St. Eutropius and his bodyguards. SS. Cleonicus and Basiliscus, Martyrs. They suffered martyrdom A.D. 296 in the reign of Diocletian the Emperor.

Our venerable father, Gerasimus, a Hermit, founded a monastery on the bank of the River Jordan. In his youth a follower of the heretic Eutyches, he did severe penance the rest of his life. Died A.D. 475 — SS. Paul and his sister Juliana, Martyrs, sent to their reward A.D. 275 in the reign of Aurelian, Emperor.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: St. Conon, Martyr, a poor Christian gardener of Nazareth in Galilee, who in Pamphylia (Asia Minor), or on the Island of Cyprus, was martyred A.D. 250 by Governor Pomplius. With nails driven through his ankles, he was forced to run before a chariot till he fell dying to be crushed under its wheels.
Forty-Two Martyrs at Ammorium: Theodore, Constantine, Callistus, Theophil and others with them, died at the hands of the Saracens about A.D. 840, in the reign of Theophilus, the Iconoclast.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: SS. Priest-Martyrs at Cherson: Basil, Ephrem, Capito, Eugene, Everius, Missionary Bishops to the Crimea and South of Russia, and four others with them. Suffered A.D. 296. — Venerable Paul, the Simple, in Egypt, a Solitary of wonderful patience and meekness. He passed away about A.D. 339 in the reign of Constantine II, Emperor.

Day Name: 3RD SUNDAY OF GREAT FAST|VENERATION OF THE CROSS
About Today: Our venerable father and confessor, Theophylact, Bishop of Nicomedia, was a disciple of Tarasius. Bishop, defended the veneration of Icons and Statues of Saints. Died in 30 year exile A.D. 845 in the reign of Emperor Michael III.
Remarks: The Divine Liturgy of St. Basil is celebrated. Veneration of the Holy Cross. All services are celebrated in red vestments. Daylight Saving Time begins.

About Today: SS. Forty Martyrs at Sebaste in Armenia, were exposed naked on a frozen pond until death by the power of Licinius A.D. 320.
Remarks: Feast of the Forty Holy Martyrs of Sebaste. Epistle, Hebrews 12:1-10; Gospel, Matthew 20:1-16.

About Today: SS. Codratus and companions: Cyprian, Anectus and Criscent, died A.D. 257 after years in prison under Valerian, Emperor.

Our holy father, Sophronius, Patriarch of Jerusalem, died A.D. 638 in the reign of Heraclius the Emperor. He revised the prominent Church Book called the "Minea," and also composed the prayer for the solemn blessing of the water on the Feast of the Epiphany.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: Our venerable father and confessor, Theophane of Syngria, was banished by the Emperor Leo the Armenian for his stand against the Iconoclasts at the Second Council of Nicea A.D. 787. Died in exile A.D. 818, bound and starved to death. — Our holy father, Gregory the Great, Dialogus, Pope of Rome, who probably composed the Liturgy of the Presanctified for the Eastern Churches. He died A.D. 604 in the reign of Emperor Phocas.

Day Name: Translation of the Relics of Nicephorus—Patriarch
About Today: Translation of Relics of our father, Nicephorus, Patriarch of Constantinople. He defended the practice of the veneration of Icons in the persecution of Leo the Armenian. He died in the fifteenth year of his exile A.D. 771 in the reign of Constantine V Copronymus, Emperor. (Confer June 2.)
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: Our venerable father, Benedict, Abbot. He founded in Italy in the sixth century the Benedictine Order based on the rules of St. Basil the Great, hence merited the title of "Patriarch of the Western Monks." Died A.D. 543. — St. Alexander of Pidna, Priest-Martyr, suffered and died in Thrace A.D. 272 in the reign of Aurelian, Emperor.

Day Name: 4TH SUNDAY OF THE GREAT FAST|JOHN CLIMACUS—VENERABLE
About Today: St. Agapius, Martyr, and with him six others. Timolaus, two Alexanders, Romel, two Dionisii. These were put to death A.D. 290 in the reign of Diocletian, Emperor.
Remarks: The Divine Liturgy of St. Basil is celebrated.

About Today: SS. Sabinus and Papas, Martyrs, Egyptians, were thrown into the River Nile A.D. 296 in the persecution under Diocletian. — St. Julian, Martyr, died A.D. 298 in the reign of Maximian, Emperor. — St. Alexander, Priest-Martyr, Pope of Rome, passed away about A.D. 119 under Hadrian, Emperor.
Our venerable father, Alexis, man of God, was the only son of a Roman Senator; died A.D. 404. Pope Innocent I and the Emperor Honorius are said to have been present at his burial.

Our holy father, Cyril, Archbishop of Jerusalem. His "Catechetical Instruction," given to the Catechumens, on the elements of the Faith are among the most precious documents of Catholic teaching. He was named by Pope Leo XII among the Doctors of the Church. He died A.D. 386 in the reign of Theodosius, Emperor. — SS. Alexandra, Claudia, Evphrasia and other Martyrs who suffered death in Missena A.D. 237, during the reign of Maximian, Emperor.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

Day Name: Great Canon of St. Andrew of Crete
About Today: SS. Chrysanthus and Daria, Martyrs, came from the East to Rome, where they suffered death by being buried alive A.D. 283. — Our venerable father, Thomas, Patriarch of Constantinople, died in peace during the reign of Phocas, Emperor A.D. 608.
Remarks: Great Canon of St. Andrew of Crete. The Presanctified Liturgy may be celebrated.

Day Name: Venerable Fathers of the St. Sabbas Monastery
About Today: Our venerable fathers, martyred in the Monastery of St. Sabbas.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: Our venerable father and confessor, James of Catania, Bishop, died in the persecution of the Iconoclasts A.D. 765.

Day Name: 5TH SUNDAY OF THE GREAT FAST|MARY OF EGYPT—VENERABLE
About Today: St. Basil, Priest-martyr, Presbyter of the Church in Ancyra, was thrown to the wild beasts in the arena at Caesarea in Palestine A.D. 363 under Julian the Apostate. — Venerable Isaak, Monk.
Remarks: The Divine Liturgy of St. Basil is celebrated.

About Today: St. Nicon, Venerable-martyr and two hundred disciples fled the persecution in Palestine to a refuge in Sicily where they were put to death A.D. 250 under Decius, Emperor.

Our venerable father, Zachary, and James, Confessor. — Our holy father, Artemius, Bishop of Thessalonica, a Selucian by birth, he was elevated to the Bishopric by St. Paul the Apostle. — St. Artemon, Martyr-presbyter of Laodicea, was burned to death A.D. 305 under Diocletian, Emperor.
Annunciation of the Theotokos made by the Archangel Gabriel. (This Feast of B. V. Mary is celebrated from the 5th century.)
Remarks: Feast of the Annunciation. Vespers with the Divine Liturgy of St. John Chrysostom is celebrated in the evening. Old Testament Readings: Genesis 43:25-45:16; Proverbs 21:23-22:4; Exodus 3:1-8; Proverbs 8:22-29. Simple abstinence from meat.

About Today: Synaxis of the Archangel Gabriel. His chief ministry to mankind was his appearing to the Theotokos to tell her that she was chosen Mother of the Messias. St. Gabriel was the Angel sent to Zachary also, to announce the conception of St. John the Baptist. (Confer July 13.)
Our holy mother, Matrona of Seluna, Martyr, was imprisoned and cruelly tortured with fire to death.
Remarks: Simple abstinence from meat. Presanctified Divine Liturgy celebrated.

About Today: Our venerable father, Hilary, Monk, and St. Stephen, wonderworker, died during the reign of Leo the Armenian. — St. Jonas and his brother, St. Barachisius of Bethasa, Martyrs, and others, suffered cruel tortures under King Sapor of Persia and died A.D. 327 in the reign of Constantine, Emperor.
Our venerable father, Mark, Bishop of Arethusa, and Cyril, a Palestinian Deacon, and other Martyrs, suffered death from tortures under Julian the Apostate A.D. 362 for destruction of idol temples.
Remarks: Palm Sunday. Blessing of Willows and Palms.

About Today: Our venerable father, John Climacus, Hegumen-Abbot, born in Palestine. At the age of 16 he declined a brilliant worldly future and retired to a Monastery on Mt. Sinai, where at the age of 75, chosen Hegumen-Abbot, he wrote the famous "Ladder of Perfection." He died A.D. 605. — Venerable John the Silent, Bishop of Colonia, in Armenia. Resigned his Bishopric and retired into the Monastery of St. Sabbas, where, concealing the fact that he was a Bishop, he did menial work. Called for ordination by St. Sabbas, his true state was revealed in confidence. Aged 104, he died A.D. 558.
Remarks: Holy Week. The Presanctified Divine Liturgy is celebrated on Monday and Tuesday. A Gospel is read at the Presanctified Divine Liturgies.

About Today: Venerable father, Hypatius, Bishop of Gangra, in Paphlagonia (Asia Minor), he attended the Ecumenical Council of Nicea A.D. 325, and defended the Faith. Returning from Nicea, heretics attacked and stoned him to death, during the reign of Constantine, the Great, Emperor.
Remarks: Holy Week. The Presanctified Divine Liturgy is celebrated on Monday and Tuesday. A Gospel is read at the Presanctified Divine Liturgies.
